questions.question: Is there a yellow bow present on the head of the left teddy bear?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the left teddy bear is comprised of mosaic tiles with no indication of a bow on its head. Examining these elements combined with general knowledge about object design, a yellow bow on the head should be clearly distinct but is absent in this version.

questions.question: Is there a turquoise ribbon tied around the neck of the right teddy bear?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the right teddy bear has a turquoise ribbon around its neck, which is portrayed through the mosaic tiles. The color and placement of the ribbon is visibly identifiable as turquoise.

questions.question: Do the paws of the left teddy bear have yellow coloring?
questions.explanation: Image B shows the left teddy bear with paws that are primarily constructed of mosaic tiles with various colors but not distinctly yellow on the paws themselves.

questions.question: Do the paws of the right teddy bear have turquoise coloring?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the paws of the right teddy bear appear in a mosaic pattern that includes various colors including turquoise, suggesting a turquoise influence, especially visible on its body.

questions.question: Are both teddy bears equipped with black button eyes?
questions.explanation: Both teddy bears in Image B have their eyes represented as black circular pieces among their mosaic designs. This suggests the representation of eyes similar to black button eyes.

questions.question: Do both teddy bears have white snouts with brown noses?
questions.explanation: In Image B, both teddy bears feature a white mosaic area where their snouts are, and their noses are visibly brown, aligning with descriptions of white snouts and brown noses.

questions.question: Are both teddy bears sitting upright with their arms resting at their sides?
questions.explanation: Both teddy bears in Image B are positioned in an upright, seated manner with arms resting downward towards their sides, correlating with common seated teddy bear postures.

questions.question: Are the two teddy bears positioned side-by-side, facing forward?
questions.explanation: Image B depicts the two teddy bears seated closely next to each other and both facing towards the viewer, indicating a side-by-side, forward-facing arrangement.

questions.question: Do both teddy bears have round heads and rounded ears?
questions.explanation: Both teddy bears in Image B exhibit round heads with the ears forming rounded shapes, consistent with the typical teddy bear design that features rounded heads and ears.
